required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Scandinavian Cohort Study for Optimal Use of Portal Vein Embolization
clinical_study.official_title: Scandinavian Cohort Study for Optimal Use of Portal Vein Embolization

brief_summary.textblock: Several aspects on the use of portal vein embolization (PVE) are poorly studied and todays recommendations are based on low-grade evidence. In this Scandinavian multicenter cohort study we will study some of the controversial aspects on the use of PVE to try to provide clearer answers on its optimal use. Six tertiary university hospital hepatobiliary units in Sweden, Norway and Denmark participate and contribute with all PVE procedures performed at their units during the study period. We will then study several aspects PVE technique in relation to induced hypertrophy and surgical outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Based on radiology around 4 weeks before and after intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of segment 4 embolization on hypertrophy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on radiology around 4 weeks before and after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in future liver remnant (%) dependeing on if segment 4 is embolized or not.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on radiology around 4 weeks before and after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in future liver remnant (%) dependeing on the levels of bilirubin before portal vein embolization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on radiology around 4 weeks before and after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in future liver remnant (%) dependeing on the level of sarcopenia before portal vein embolization.

arm_group.description: Right portal vein embolization. All patients subjected to selective right portal vein embolization prior to planned hepatobiliary surgery.

Right portal vein embolization including segment 4 portal vein branches. All patients subjected to selective right portal vein embolization including segment 4 portal vein branches prior to planned hepatobiliary surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Scandinavian patients subjected to PVE at 6 hepatobiliary centers during the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Right-sided PVE
Exclusion Criteria:
- Left-sided PVE

responsible_party.investigator_title: Acting Head of HPB Surgery, MD PhD

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be made available to other researchers on demand.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be made available to other researchers on demand.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data will be made available to other researchers on demand.
